gurmukhi: ਜੋ ਯਹ ਕਥਾ ਪੜੈ ਸੁਨੈ ਰਿੱਧਿ ਸਿੱਧਿ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਤਾਸ ||੧||੬੫||
transliteration: Jo Yah Kathaa Padai Sounai Riddh(i) Siddh(i) Grih Taas||1||65||
translation: He who read or listens to this discourse, he will attain in his house wealth and miraculous powers.1.65.
When it was learnt that Dhumar Nain had been killed,
The demon-king then called Chand and Mund.
They were sent after bestowing many honours on them.

transliteration: Hai Gad Pat(i) Dooe Rath Naanaa||2||66||
translation: And also many gifts like horses, elephants and chariots.2.66.
Those who had earlier seen the goddess;
They were sent towards kailash mountain (as spies).

gurmukhi: ਤਿਨ ਕੀ ਤਨਕ ਭਨਕ ਸੁਨਿ ਪਾੲੀ ||
transliteration: Tin Koo Tanak Bhanak Soun(i) Paaoo||
translation: When the goddess heard some rumour about them;
She then promptly came down with her weapons and armour.3.67.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਜਿ ਸਾਜਿ ਚਲੇ ਤਹਾਂ ਰਣ ਰਾਛਸੇਂਦ੍ਰ ਅਨੇਕ ||
transliteration: Saaj(i) Saj(i) Chale Tahaan Ran Raachhsendra Anek||
translation: Decorating their forces many demon-generals marched towards the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਅਰਧ ਮੁੰਡਿਤ ਮੁੰਡਿਤੇਕ ਜਟਾ ਧਰੇ ਸੁ ਅਰੇਕ ||
transliteration: Ardh Mounndit Muaaditek Jataa Ddare Sudarek||
translation: Many warriors are with half-shaven heads, many with fullshaven hads and many are with matted hair.

gurmukhi: ਕੋਪਿ ਓਪੰ ਦੈ ਸਭੈ ਕਰ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਨਚਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Kop(i) Opan Dai Sabhai Kar Sastra Astra Nachaae||
translation: All of them in great fury, are causing the dance of their weapons and armour.
